headline: Is Western Gateway’s Southwest Fuel Push Altering The Investment Case For Kinder Morgan (KMI)?
summary: In December 2025, Phillips 66 and Kinder Morgan announced that the proposed Western Gateway refined products pipeline had attracted strong shipper commitments, prompting plans for a second open season to fill remaining capacity and extend service into Los Angeles via a reversed SFPP line. This project would reconfigure existing pipelines and link Midwestern refinery supply to Phoenix, California and Las Vegas, potentially enhancing Kinder Morgan’s role in critical fuel logistics across the...

headline: Lindsey oil refinery buyer will not restart fuel production
summary: The winning bidder for one of the country's last remaining oil refineries has said it does not plan to restart fuel production at the site and cannot guarantee how many jobs will be retained.  It was announced on Monday that Phillips 66, which already owns the Humber Refinery in north-east Lincolnshire, had agreed a deal to buy the nearby Prax Lindsey refinery assets.  The Prax Lindsey refinery was wound up from June last year with the loss of 125 jobs after its parent firm called in administrators.

The Prax Lindsey refinery was wound up from June last year with the loss of 125 jobs after its parent firm called in administrators.
